project.teaser: R-Map aims to analyze the impact of remote working arrangements (RWAs) on the disparities between urban and rural regions in Europe. The project bases its research on the premise that understanding and shaping the trends related to the emergence of RWAs provides an opportunity...
project.objective: R-Map aims to analyze the impact of remote working arrangements (RWAs) on the disparities between urban and rural regions in Europe. The project bases its research on the premise that understanding and shaping the trends related to the emergence of RWAs provides an opportunity to bridge the urban-rural divide affecting its multiple facets. To achieve its goals, R-Map will produce an Integrated Impact Assessment Framework (powered by the R-Map model) that will allow the assessment of individual, social, economic, environmental and spatial impacts of RWAs. A visualization platform will be developed leveraging the R-Map model to provide visualization and interactive services allowing decision-makers to monitor and assess how remote work arrangements affect people, communities, space, economy, and environment in urban and rural regions. The developed tools will be applied at local level to monitor and assess current remote working trends across six representative use-cases in the EU and the AC, in regions within Greece, United Kingdom, Italy, Turkey, Netherlands-Germany, Austria-Switzerland (two cross-border cases). Using scenario building and forecasting methodologies, R-Map will move on to explore the potential future impact of remote work in these regions for the next 5-10 years and formulate policy recommendations on how to create environments conducive to remote work, that are tailored to the needs of local governments in both urban and rural settings. Cross-regional exchanges between stakeholders and policy roundtables will help move beyond the regional focus ensuring the replication of results across areas with different characteristics in Europe and beyond. By taking a comprehensive approach to research on RWAs, R-Map addresses the role and the needs of policymakers, employers, workers, researchers, and civil society, providing capacity to urban and rural regions to seize the opportunities and cope with the challenges brought by remote work.
project.title: Mapping, understanding, assessing and predicting the effects of remote working arrangements in urban and rural areas
project.keywords: remote work, urban-rural divide, impact assessment framework, scenario building, forecasting, regional policies, interactive visualisation

article.title: Studying the impact of remote work on regional imbalances

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - R-Map (Mapping, understanding, assessing and predicting the effects of remote working arrangements in urban and rural areas)
result.teaser: R-Map aims to analyze the impact of remote working arrangements (RWAs) on the disparities between urban & rural regions in Europe. To achieve its goals, R-Map will produce an Integrated Impact Assessment Framework (powered by the R-Map model) that will allow the assessment of...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: The R-Map model
result.description: A report which in its 1st version (M12) will specify the R-Map model specs and its co-design process. In the second version (M14) the report will be updated with information about the R-Map model using state-of-the-art statistical and machine learning methods and will be accompanied by the developed R-Map model which will be using as input the results of the data fusion techniques integrating heterogenous data coming from the large-scale survey, open datasets and qualitative methods as well as the results of the spatial factor and sensitivity analysis in an operational way. It will draw on spatial, statistical and machine learning techniques to analyse how RWAs affect the urban-rural divide at regional level.

result.title: Dissemination and Communication plan, activities and results
result.description: A report outlining in its first version (M3) the dissemination and communication plan of R-Map. A second version will be provided at the end of the first reporting period (M15). The second version will also provide information on the final communication products envisioned at this stage including: project’s logo and promotional package (leaflet, poster, templates); social media presence; project’s web portal. It will also provide information on the newsletters and the 45-second promo video. This video will outline the project objectives and will have an appropriate audiovisual format (e.g. .MP4, .AVI, .WEBM, .MOV) to ensure quality, support by web browsers and programs, ability to move, share, convert, etc.An updated version (M36) will summarize the results of the R-Map dissemination and communication activities. The third version will also provide information on the 60-second promo video. This video will summarize key research results and key policy recommendations and will have an appropriate audiovisual format (e.g. .MP4, .AVI, .WEBM, .MOV) to ensure quality, support by web browsers and programs, ability to move, share, convert, etc.

result.title: Spatial implications of remote working arrangements across Europe and beyond
result.description: A report summarizing the spatial implications of remote working arrangements.

result.title: Management and Quality Plan and Data Management Plan
result.description: A report outlining the management and quality plan of the project and which will also include the data management plan. This report will be submitted in M3 and updated in M15 and M36.

result.title: Current status and emerging trends of remote working arrangements in Europe and beyond
result.description: A report presenting the state of play and future outlook of remote working arrangements.

result.title: Potential effects of remote working arrangements on the working and living conditions
result.description: A report reflecting the effects of remote working on individual level (working and living conditions).

result.title: R-Map policy briefs
result.description: Two policy briefs will be developed (M15 & M36) to meet policy feedback operational needs and help R-Map get extra visibility among the concerned EC policy services.

result.title: Potential socio-economic effects of remote working arrangements
result.description: A report documenting the socio-economic effects of remote working arrangements.

result.title: Exploitation and Sustainability Plan
result.description: A report describing the consortium’s plans and actions for post project exploitation of R-Map results.

result.title: A large-scale dataset for analysing remote working in urban and rural areas across Europe

details.authors: Katharina Fellnhofer 1,2 ✉ , Margarita angelidou 3,4 , Johannes Flacke 5 , Lisa Fontanella 6 , Mandy Fransz 7 , Özge Karanfil 8,9 , Eirini Kelmali 10 , Sibel Kiran 8 , Pavlos Kolias 10 , Vidit Kundu 5 , Konstantina Mataftsi 11 , Thomas Mone 3 , G

result.title: The R-Map platform
result.description: A report specifying in its 1st version (M12) the R-Map platform architecture and its co-design process. In the second version (M16) the report will be updated to include a list of data to be visualization on the R-Map platform and their visualization potential. In the third and the fourth version (M22 & M36) the report will be updated to include information about the developed R-Map platform along with its services. The third and the fourth version of this report will be accompanied by the developed highly visualization platform which will integrate the R-MAP model as background algorithm and additional datasets to provide an operational tool allowing the visualization of the assessment of the individual, socio-economic and spatial effects of RWAs and of adaptive what-if scenarios.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
